marriage_conditions.5: Conditions for valid Hindu marriage - Monogamy, age (21 for male, 18 for female), sound mind, not within prohibited degrees
marriage_conditions.7: Marriage ceremonies - Saptapadi (seven steps) essential for valid marriage
marriage_conditions.8: Registration of Hindu marriages - Optional but recommended for legal proof
marriage_conditions.11: Void marriages - Bigamy, prohibited relationship, sapinda relationship
marriage_conditions.12: Voidable marriages - Impotency, mental disorder, pregnancy by another man, consent by fraud/force

restitution_conjugal_rights.9: Restitution of conjugal rights - Spouse can petition if other withdraws from society without reasonable excuse
restitution_conjugal_rights.9A: Alternative relief in restitution proceedings - Court may grant judicial separation or divorce

judicial_separation.10: Judicial separation on grounds of adultery, cruelty, desertion, conversion, mental disorder, venereal disease, renunciation, presumption of death
judicial_separation.22: Resumption of cohabitation after judicial separation - Parties can resume married life

divorce_grounds.13: Divorce grounds - Adultery, cruelty, desertion for 2 years, conversion, mental disorder, leprosy, venereal disease, renunciation, not heard alive for 7 years
divorce_grounds.13A: Alternate relief in divorce proceedings - Court may grant judicial separation instead
divorce_grounds.13B: Divorce by mutual consent - After 1 year of marriage, by mutual agreement, 6-18 months waiting period
divorce_grounds.14: Bars to matrimonial relief - No petition within 1 year of marriage except exceptional hardship

divorce_wife_grounds.13_2: Additional grounds for wife - Husband remarried before Act, husband guilty of rape/sodomy/bestiality, repudiation of marriage before age 15, non-resumption of cohabitation after decree of maintenance

nullity_marriage.11: Void marriages - Petition for nullity can be filed by either party
nullity_marriage.12: Voidable marriages - Petition within 1 year of discovering fraud or force

maintenance_alimony.24: Maintenance pendente lite - Interim maintenance during proceedings based on income and needs
maintenance_alimony.25: Permanent alimony - Court can order monthly/lump sum payment considering income, property, conduct
maintenance_alimony.27: Maintenance to wife after divorce - Wife entitled to maintenance if not remarried and unable to maintain herself

custody_children.26: Custody of children - Court decides based on child's welfare, age, wishes, parent's conduct and capacity
custody_children.26A: Welfare of child paramount - Best interest of child is primary consideration
custody_children.26B: Visitation rights - Non-custodial parent entitled to meet child regularly

property_rights.27A: Wife's right to residence - Wife entitled to live in matrimonial home
property_rights.27B: Stridhan - Wife's exclusive property including gifts, jewelry, inherited property
property_rights.27C: Division of property - Court can order equitable distribution of jointly acquired property

procedure.19: Court's duty to reconcile - Court must make efforts to reconcile parties before granting divorce
procedure.20: Jurisdiction - District Court where marriage solemnized or parties last resided or respondent resides
procedure.21: Proceedings to be in camera - Divorce proceedings held in private to protect privacy
procedure.21A: Decree not to be granted within 6 months - Cooling off period for mutual consent divorce
procedure.28: Appeals - Appeal to High Court within 90 days of decree

special_provisions.15: Divorced persons when may marry again - After decree becomes final
special_provisions.16: Legitimacy of children - Children of void/voidable marriages are legitimate
special_provisions.17: Punishment of bigamy - Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine under IPC Section 494
special_provisions.18: Punishment for contravention of decrees - Imprisonment up to 1 year or fine up to Rs.1,000

maintenance_amounts.25A: Factors for determining alimony - Income, property, standard of living, duration of marriage, age, health, earning capacity
maintenance_amounts.25B: Modification of alimony - Court can increase/decrease based on changed circumstances
maintenance_amounts.25C: Enforcement of alimony - Attachment of salary, property, arrest for non-payment

domestic_violence.498A_reference: Cruelty includes physical and mental torture - Refer IPC Section 498A for criminal action
domestic_violence.DV_Act_reference: Protection of Women from Domestic Violence Act 2005 provides additional remedies

mediation.23A: Mandatory mediation - Family courts must refer cases to mediation
mediation.23B: Mediation timeline - 60 days for mediation process
